copyright.label: Copyright
copyright.infobox0: The work is dedicated by the authors to the public domain, thereby relinquishing their copyright. The work may be reused, distributed, remixed, adapted, and built upon in any medium or format, without any conditions.
copyright.infobox1: The work may be reused (including commercially), distributed, remixed, adapted, and built upon in any medium or format, as long as the authors of the work are credited.
copyright.infobox2: The work may be reused (including commercially), distributed, remixed, adapted, and built upon in any medium or format, as long as the authors are credited. If the work is modified, the modified work must be licensed under the same terms.
copyright.infobox3: The work may be reused (including commercially) only in unchanged form, copied and redistributed, as long as the authors of the work are credited.
copyright.infobox4: The work may be reused (including commercially) only in unchanged form, copied and redistributed, as long as the authors of the work are credited.
copyright.infobox5: The work may be reused (including commercially), distributed, remixed, adapted, and built upon in any medium or format, as long as the authors are credited. If the work is modified, the modified work must be licensed under the same conditions.
copyright.infobox6: The work may be reused (including commercially) only in unchanged form, copied and redistributed, as long as the authors of the work are credited.

form.title: Marburg Knowledge Spaces Web Form
form.richTextBoxPlaceholder: In this free text field, you can share anything about the building that you would like to tell us. For example (but certainly not exclusively), you could write about questions like: How did research and teaching take place in the building? Who worked or works there? What did you experience in this building? Which groups or working groups met there? Did life in the building reflect the ongoing transformation that characterizes the University of Marburg? Did everyday life in the building reflect the diversity of the University of Marburg, or were diversity and respect lacking? Was new knowledge created with curiosity and responsibility?
form.infobox: Useful information about the building that is not covered by other fields.
form.errorSending: Error sending the markup file to GitLab.
form.resetFormDescription: Are you sure you want to reset the form? All entered data will be deleted.

FormSubmit.title: Thank you
FormSubmit.description: Your data has been successfully saved. Would you like to add additional fields to your entry?

FormReset.title: Form reset
FormReset.description: Are you sure you want to reset the form? All entered data will be deleted.

LoadExample.title: Load example data
LoadExample.description: Are you sure you want to load example data? All entered data will be deleted.

dataSubmission.question: What happens when I submit my data?
dataSubmission.answer: When you submit your data, it will be transformed into a structured Markdown file. This file is then uploaded to our database for moderation before being integrated into the system.

sourceManagement.question: How do I add sources to my entries?
sourceManagement.answer: Each field can have sources added. Click 'Add Source' next to a field to provide source information and additional references.

fieldNavigation.question: How can I navigate through many fields?
fieldNavigation.answer: Use the Field Navigator on the right side of the screen. It provides a quick overview of all your fields and lets you jump directly to any section.

imageUpload.question: What should I know about uploading images?
imageUpload.answer: You must provide copyright information for each image. Common image formats are accepted, and you can upload multiple images for various views of the building.

addFields.question: How do I add new fields?
addFields.answer: Click 'Add more fields' to open the property selector. Choose the fields you want to add and click 'Add selected properties'.

saveChanges.question: How do I save my changes?
saveChanges.answer: Click the green 'Save' button at the bottom of the form. Your data will be saved, and you can continue editing or start a new entry.

resetForm.question: Can I reset the form?
resetForm.answer: Yes, click 'Reset all fields' at the bottom of the form. After confirmation, all entered data will be cleared.

richText.question: What are rich text fields?
richText.answer: Rich text fields allow formatted text with additional details that don't fit into standard fields. Add them using the 'Add rich text' button.

SignupForm.title: Sign Up
SignupForm.privacyPolicyLabel: I agree to the privacy policy
SignupForm.privacyPolicyRequired: You must agree to the privacy policy
SignupForm.welcomeMessage:
The University of Marburg celebrates its 500th anniversary in 2027. These celebrations are accompanied by the Knowledge Spaces research project. The goal is to explore the history of science through university architecture.

While much has been written about individual professors, others and especially research and teaching practices as well as everyday life in the city and at the university often remain in the dark. We need you to help add these missing puzzle pieces to the overall picture! Help us bring university history to life with your knowledge and memories by sharing your stories about one or more buildings. What took place in which building? Who taught where and how? What research projects were being worked on during your time? How has the cityscape changed? Where did you discuss with your people? What do you know about the history of science and university buildings? These and many other aspects help complete the picture. Use the preset fields, add more, or share your knowledge in the free text field. We look forward to your contribution.

While entering your information, the data is stored in cookies before being converted into a markdown file and stored in the university's internal Gitlab after submission. The Knowledge Spaces team will then evaluate the data and incorporate the information, as much as possible, into Wikimedia family formats (Wikipedia, Wikidata, Wikicommons etc.) to keep the data sustainably accessible and updatable for the public even after the anniversary year and the end of the Knowledge Spaces project. At the same time, an app will be designed with the knowledge that goes beyond just hard facts and data, bringing the history of science and everyday life at Philipps University to life. We would therefore be very pleased if we could engage in an exchange with you about the alma mater and if you would contribute to the anniversary. After the anniversary year or when you inform us beforehand, we will of course delete all personal data and information from the web form. Until then, only members of the Knowledge Spaces project team have access to your data and information.

We need your email address so that we can contact you if we have questions about your entries, especially in the free text field.

If you have any further questions, feel free to take a look at the FAQ on the next page or contact the Knowledge Spaces team directly. You can reach us by email at andreas.schuebeler@staff.uni-marburg.de.
